intro: Reseda longicalycina, commonly known as the long calyx reseda, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other well-known plants such as cabbage and mustard. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Reseda longicalycina is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its compact size and attractive foliage.
